channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: Subornation of perjury is a crime for lawyers, shouldn’t it at least be unethical for journalists and news orgs?
item.source:markdown: Subornation of perjury is a crime for lawyers, shouldn’t it at least be unethical for journalists and news orgs?

item.description: The focus in WordPress-land should, imho, be on writers. There's so much more it can do. Keep it simple and streamlined, stay out of their way, and offer lots of choice. It has all the features "social web" need but don't have. And it's deployed, scaled, debugged, and ready to serve as a strong foundation.
item.source:markdown: The focus in WordPress-land should, imho, be on writers. There's so much more it can do. Keep it simple and streamlined, stay out of their way, and offer lots of choice. It has all the features "social web" need but don't have. And it's deployed, scaled, debugged, and ready to serve as a strong foundation.

item.description: I don't think you can claim to be part of the "social web" if you don't support links, btw. It's the most basic feature of the web.
item.source:markdown: I don't think you can claim to be part of the "social web" if you don't support links, btw. It's the most basic feature of the web.

item.description: So far we've only created reading portals. What I want for myself and for you, is a writing portal. Think about it.
item.source:markdown: So far we've only created reading portals. What I want for myself and for you, is a writing portal. Think about it.

item.description: I'm still waiting for the podcast client that can subscribe to OPML lists, so I can subscribe to shows from my desktop. If one of them did, we could start curated lists of feeds put together by smart people and influencers.
item.source:markdown: I'm still waiting for the podcast client that can subscribe to OPML lists, so I can subscribe to shows from my desktop. If one of them did, we could start curated lists of feeds put together by smart people and influencers.

item.description: You'll see this now every time you see El Orange speak.

item.description: Trade Secrets Radio: What is podcasting? This is the exact moment (9/24/2004) that podcasting got its name and its definition. We loved what RSS did for news, now we were doing the same thing for radio, not just talking but doing. If you were there, you remember this as well as I do.
item.source:markdown: Trade Secrets Radio: What is podcasting? This is the exact moment (9/24/2004) that podcasting got its name and its definition. We loved what RSS did for news, now we were doing the same thing for radio, not just talking but doing. If you were there, you remember this as well as I do.
